content.description: Climb up the wide chimney underneath the massive chockstone. Exit the chimney to the right via the crack in the roof(crux). Follow the right facing corner with awesome jams to the top! One last hard move leads to some easier climbing and the anchors. After you complete the climb, make sure to run both strands of the rope into the pitons to your right. This will save you from having to jug back up when the crack eats your rope.
content.protection: Standard ADK rack to #2. Some doubles in the hand/finger size might be nice.  Fixed anchor.
content.location: On the right end of this crag is a massive chockstone that protrudes from the wall.  The start is the chimney/stem box underneath this block.  For a little extra wow factor, check out the area inside and behind that block, it appears to be held there by magic and fairy dust!

content.description: Climbs far better than it looks! Start up the slab and trend right into the terraced corner. Pull both of these(if going left on the second, beware of your rope in the crack) and continue up to the base of the wall. Use a variation of jam and stem techniques to work up the corner until you pull onto a ledge to your right. Make a move up the right facing corner and then work up and left into the hand crack on the face(crux). Follow this to the top.
content.protection: Standard ADK rack to #3 and a single #4. One could easily dump large gear into this route, but smaller options abound. Fixed anchor.
content.location: There is a very obvious offwidth crack in the back corner of this crag. This is Pan's Protege. The start is the same as Forever Young at the base of the slab.

content.description: Climb the slab to a bolt, then up to a ledge. Continue up to the glorious looking, slightly overhanging finger crack.  The locks are superb!  When the lower crack ends, transfer to the crack on the left (crux) and follow this to the ledge where you'll find bolted rings.
content.protection: Small gear, doubles in the finger sizes are helpful!  Fixed anchor.
content.location: There is a very obvious offwidth crack in the corner of this crag.  20 feet to the left of the corner is a finger crack that splits the slightly overhanging orange wall.  This is Forever Young.

content.description: Climb a dirty slab and traverse right into the off-width corner which starts as 5" and widens to 6". Climb the corner (crux) past two ledges/rests. Finish up a fist crack and exit to a ledge with a bolted anchor.
content.protection: Double 6", double 5", a 3.5"-4", and a 2" piece   Two bolt anchor
content.location: Start: Below the obvious 5-6" corner crack formed by the large detached boulder

content.description: A small cluster of good routes easily identified by the obvious off-width corner of Blockus.
